newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila central bank cuts overnight rates.
newsitem.headline: Manila central bank cuts overnight rates.

text.p: The Philippine central bank said on Wednesday it dropped its overnight borrowing rate to 18 percent from 20 percent with effect from Thursday.
It cut its overnight lending rate to 22 percent from 25 percent.
The central bank also decided to trim its borrowing rates on the five-day to one-month reverse repos at 13 percent each from 15 percent.
The central bank had been adjusting down its overnight rates since it raised these to a 2 1/2-year high on July 10 in defense of the peso.
The central bank eventually let the peso move in a wider range on July 11 to end months of speculation arising from the currency turmoil in the region.
"As I told you, this is a temporary situation. We are aware that the main concern of business is high interest rates," central bank governor Gabriel Singson told reporters.
With the drop in the overnight rates, Treasury bill rates are likewise expected to decline, Singson added.
